thread.title: Martin Truex Jr. comes full circle at Dover
thread.title_full: Martin Truex Jr. comes full circle at Dover

author: app.com
title: Martin Truex Jr. comes full circle at Dover
text:
MORE Martin Truex Jr. remembers surveying the Monster Mile’s steeply banked turns for the first time in 2000, back when he was a 19-year-old driving the No. 56 SeaWatch Chevy for his father on the old Busch North Series.
How setting up the car was total guesswork for them, made worse by the rain that cut into practice time.
“I can tell you details from every race I ever ran and everything that happened that weekend,” he laughed. “I have a hard time remembering people’s names, but I remember stuff like that.”
That kind of memory can be a blessing and a curse in a sport where the high octane-fueled ups and downs can make for a wild ride.
Truex might want to forget everything about the 2014 season, an unmitigated disaster on the track that was equally difficult away from it for the native of the Mayetta section of Stafford.
Except that’s what makes the kind of year the Sprint Cup Series veteran is having now so memorable.
Truex returns to Dover International Speedway for Sunday’s AAA 400 in contention for his first championship, sitting ninth in the point standings, with the top 12 at the end of the weekend advancing to the Contender Round of the Chase.
“To be in a position where you don’t know if you’ll ever get that opportunity again to be near the top or at the top, win races, be with a team that’s capable of doing the things that we’ve done,” he said. “You never know what tomorrow is going to bring. So I think it definitely gives you that perspective, and it teaches you to enjoy the good days a little bit more, for sure.”
